direction.raw_text: R
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data is still restrained on the table, but a conduit has been placed above his head and is dripping condensation onto his face. Data is now a completely new being. His entire BODY is now made of HUMAN FLESH. It's a shocking sight -- for anyone who ever wondered what Data would look like human, we're now getting our first look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from her nest in the ceiling. She watches Data for a moment... rubs the moisture into his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data, although clearly enraptured with his new sensations and feelings still struggles to maintain his own sense of identity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To his surprise, Data finds that he is becoming drawn to this strange creature and all that she can offer him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He struggles, but ultimately there's only one answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without taking her eyes away from Data, she reaches out a hand and touches a control on a nearby console. The color of Data's FACE turns an ASHEN GRAY --  as though the blood has drained from his skin. Another droplet of moisture falls and hits him on the cheek -- but this time his eyes widen in shock. The sensation of human feeling is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves in close on him, an edge creeping into her voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hits the control, and the COLOR returns to his face. Data gasps -- filled with feeling once again. The Borg Queen runs her hand across his cheek -- her attitude seductive and affectionate once again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She touches the control again. Data is shocked back into his cold, android self. He's like a heroin addict being denied his "high" with the flick of a switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data struggles, anguished... we've never seen him like this before... completely beaten down... finally, he nods. The Borg Queen touches the control again. A sharp intake of breath as the feeling returns to Data. And the Queen kisses him on the mouth. This time, he responds eagerly, throwing himself into the emotion of the moment. She pulls back a little, looks at him softly, passionately. Data stares back at her, breathless -- he seems to be completely in her thrall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Borg Queen's smile of victory...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Borg in all but name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weak) I am... grateful for what you have given me. But I still do not wish to be assimilated.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then take the final step... give me the Enterprise... and we can be together... always.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I cannot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've deactivated the sensory inputs. That flesh on your body is just meat, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no, please... you cannot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must give me what I want... now. Without the deflector dish, we can no longer send for an early invasion. We must assimilate Earth ourselves. I need this ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it better like this...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... but the Enterprise... my duty...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... is to yourself. Don't make me hurt you again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no, it's so... empty... please... give it back... I need it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I need to control this ship. Let me into your mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In order to access my neural net... you will need to create a positronic interface. (beat) I will tell you how.

direction.raw_text: tucked inside the craft. dialogue.raw_text: The nacelles are charged... nuclear warhead standing by. We're ready to ignite the warp drive.

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             221 The Borg Queen is floating in the middle of the room, surrounded by Borg consoles and technology. Data is still on the table, with some kind of specialized conduit connecting his head to a group of monitors, which are inactive at the moment. He appears to be caught up in the rapture of his new sensations, and his personal connection to the Borg Queen. All thought of his Starfleet responsibilities are gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data thinks for a moment, and the monitors suddenly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the equipment around the Queen HUMS with POWER. Information about critical Enterprise systems flows across the monitor screens -- we might recognize graphics from the Bridge displays. The Borg are now in control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data nods... but then one of the consoles BEEPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data tilts his head and -- 222   A MONITOR                                                  222 shows an exterior space shot. The image rapidly ZOOMS
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the distant PHOENIX. The ship is racing through space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data nods. Another console lights up. She moves to work it herself...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Queen) I am re-routing Bridge command functions to this location.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eliminate their remaining defenses. I will send Borg to assimilate the rest of the crew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts) There is a perimeter alert. A ship has entered sensor range.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vulcan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts, to Data) Give me helm control.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE                                223 As the ship turns and begins moving off at impulse speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHOENIX COCKPIT                                       224 As before, Picard is now steering the ship with a 21st century JOYSTICK CONTROL. The ship is moving faster and faster, trembling now, a ROAR building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CABIN shakes a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A weird DISTORTION passes through the cabin like a wave, then vanishes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Passing one-half light speed. The starboard nacelle's running a little hot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm on it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The inertial dampers are having trouble compensating... I don't think Cochrane built this thing for comfort.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Speed -- two hundred, seventy-five thousand kilometers per second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's no temporal shielding in here! We're starting to pick up relativistic effects!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One minute to warp threshold...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE                                                 225 The warp ship WHIPS by... and then a moment later, the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into view, chasing the tiny ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHOENIX COCKPIT                                       226 Geordi glances out the window... does a double-take and looks back up in surprise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, the Enterprise!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taps combadge) Picard to Enterprise. (beat) Picard to Enterprise -- do you read me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Their com system must still be down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I feel a whole lot better with them out there. We may need some help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             227 As before, the Queen floating above the helm control console. The warp ship is on the monitor, getting closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A floating CROSSHAIR appears on the monitor showing the warp ship. The Queen works the console. The crosshair moves, but refuses to lock onto the warp ship. She frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen works furiously, still can't get the crosshairs to lock onto the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hits a series of Borg controls on a nearby console... and the restraints holding Data to the table are RELEASED. Two Borg drones move to him... as he stands up and heads for the Queen, the specialized cable still attached to his head...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have repaired the weapons array. Phasers are on-line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The targeting lock isn't working.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not understand. The optical data network has been repaired, and all systems are functioning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinks) The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you configure it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE                                228 closing in on the tiny warp ship. It's like a shark chasing a guppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHOENIX COCKPIT                                       229 Ship SHAKING with power and acceleration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi glances out a side window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship is really SHAKING HARD now -- and the compartment is DISTORTING slightly, stretching, everything becoming elongated...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Approaching light speed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're getting awfully close... what the hell are they doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're crossing the threshold!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE PHOENIX                                   230 The ship is STRETCHING in the familiar "rubber band effect" that tells us a ship is going into warp... but this effect is much slower . It's on the verge of hitting warp speed. The Enterprise still on their tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             231 Data is standing right next to the Queen, and is studying the Borg console intently. Two Borg drones stand nearby, watching closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the blink of an eye:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The drone is knocked off its feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second Borg rushes at Data, swings his arm at Data's head. This is the same Borg with the deadly stiletto-tipped DRILL SPIKES seen earlier. The spikes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the flesh of Data's neck, drawing BLOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data reacts in pain. He GRABS the Borg's arm and with android strength KICKS HIM IN THE CHEST at the same time. The Borg FLIES BACKWARD, causing the cybernetic ARM to RIP from its socket in a shower of sparks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Borg Queen SWOOPS down at Data for the kill. But Data's too quick for her. With one swift motion, he turns and THROWS the BORG ARM like a JAVELIN across the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I believe I see the problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: -- DATA WHIRLS AROUND AND SLAMS AN ARM INTO ONE OF THE BORG DRONES

direction.raw_text: 232 As the spikes on the severed Borg arm PUNCTURE one of the diathermic oxygen tanks seen earlier. A HUGE EXPLOSION of DEADLY GAS bursts out of the ruptured tank. The WALL of roiling gas sweeps through the entire Borg Hive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lunges at Data just as the gas envelopes them!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE PHOENIX                                   233 As it GOES INTO WARP -- it shoots forward and streaks away from the Enterprise!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHOENIX COCKPIT                                       234 As Picard and Geordi are slammed back into their seats and the stars WHIP PAST the windows in the familiar warp effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             235 Data and the Borg Queen tearing and clawing at each other amongst the spewing gas. The Borg drones try to get away, but they are SWALLOWED by the rush of gas, fall to the deck, twitching in pain. Data and the Borg Queen both fall to the deck, grappling with each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE WARP SHIP                                 236 As it STREAKS PAST -- the warp ship flying at top speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             237 Data and the Borg Queen struggling against each other... the gas swirling around their bodies... and as it does, we see the FLESH on their bodies start to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MELT AWAY in a horrific ooze of blood and skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHOENIX COCKPIT                                       238 As before, but the ride has smoothed out considerably, Warp stars streaking by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat as Geordi works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out the front windows, the warp stars STOP... the ship
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slightly... turns to the left... Earth can be seen in the distance. They smile. It's a moment of victory.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bring us about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dropping out of warp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's begin the landing procedure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CARGO BAY/BORG HIVE                                   239 The onrush of gas is gone. But it has affected every surface of the room like an acid wash. Every piece of Borg machinery is smoking and hissing. The two Borg drones are lying on the floor, dead -- all organic matter and flesh have been dissolved from their bodies, leaving only raw mechanical skeletons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lying on the floor, still locked together. Data is a shocking image: all of his human flesh has been
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaving only his pure android self. His metallic skull gleams in the dim light... even his eyes are gone. His mechanical left arm is still intact, but the right human arm is completely gone. His torso is stripped of the human flesh, leaving pure android with no soft human touches. Data as we've never seen him before -- raw and mechanistic. Data rolls over... still locked around him is the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the Borg Queen. A metallic spinal column with two arms with clawed hands leading off it... and a blinking, electronic BRAIN STEM at the very top of the spine. Data throws off the grotesque form. The Borg Queen carcass writhes and claws at the air. She speaks in a flat, mechanical voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data reaches out with one hand... grabs the metal spinal column just below the brain stem... and SNAPS IT IN TWO. The blinking brain stem FRITZES OUT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (fritzed) Data...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR                                              241 Two Borg Drones moving down the hall suddenly stop... twitch... the blinkies on their bodies GO OUT... and they both FALL OVER DEAD. Their connection to their Queen severed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JEFFERIES TUBE                                        242 Another Borg Drone reacts... lights out... slumps over
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE                                             243 Data releases the remains of the dead Borg Queen. He leans back a little, as though exhausted by his remarkable experience. CAMERA PULLS BACK, emphasizing the loneliness of this smoking, scorched android sitting alone in the ruins of the Borg Hive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MISSILE SILO - DAY                                    244 The missile doors now open, the ground badly scorched from the launch. Scrimm and his militia guards are sitting on the ground, while Lange and the other Starfleet N.D. keep a watchful eye on them. Cochrane is sitting against a rock, while Beverly checks him over. Ruby is pacing, lost in thought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone looks up to see -- 245   PICARD AND GEORDI                                          245 standing a few feet away, tired but triumphant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard nods. Beverly, Lange and the N.D. look relieved. Ruby takes a few steps toward Picard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't anyone going to say welcome back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did it work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles up at Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi smiles and walks over to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mister La Forge... now I'd like to shake your hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stop a few feet away from each other, their eyes locked. They drink in sight of each other... there's an undercurrent of unspoken feelings and words. She smiles... he smiles back. A satisfying moment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain's log, March 3rd, 2063. The voyage of the Phoenix was a success... again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly something in the night sky catches their attention. A BRIGHT LIGHT is moving down towards the city. We now realize this is what people are reacting to...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And it appears the Vulcan ship has detected the warp signature and is now on its way to Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Just a hundred yards beyond the city limits we see the massive VULCAN SCOUT SHIP SETTLING down onto the ground. Dust flying everywhere. Windmill blades spinning wildly from the exhaust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: squinting into the wind, trying to make out what's happening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good distance away, but with a good view of the entire scene. Riker, Worf, Beverly, Troi and Geordi watching from a distance as the Vulcan ship LANDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard, Ruby and a bandaged, but much healthier Zephram Cochrane watching the landing. People from town are surging around them. Everyone is shocked and amazed at what they're seeing. Picard watches with satisfaction -- this is the moment he's been waiting for. Cochrane and Ruby are particularly awestruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: settles, engines whining down... dust settling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves to Cochrane, takes him gently by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cochrane looks a little bewildered, tries to grapple with the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cochrane looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cochrane looks at him for a moment... takes a breath, nods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear a mechanical WHIRR and a HISS of air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor Cochrane... this is your moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My God... they're really from another world?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. And they're going to want to meet the man who flew that warp ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And that's supposed to be me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zephram, you had the vision to build that ship when no one else on this planet could see beyond their own problems. (beat) You flew that ship... all I did was push a few buttons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. (beat) And don't worry -- I'll keep your secret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 255 as a HATCH opens on the Vulcan ship. The townspeople behind them react with shock and fear... a few people take a step back. Picard looks at Cochrane, who hesitates for a moment... then finally takes a deep breath... and strides out toward the alien ship. A man alone about to change the course of human history. Ruby moves closer to Picard and puts her arm around him... and he puts his arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the rest of our crew is enraptured by the moment... they glance at each other with excitement as they watch history unfold...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cochrane stops a few feet away from the ship as the hatch swings completely open... light streams out into the night air... and THREE HOODED, ROBED FIGURES EMERGE. They stand across from Cochrane -- a moment frozen in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching in awe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls his hood back, revealing the familiar slanted eyebrows and pointed ears, holding himself with that austere, regal dignity we've come to associate with his race. He steps forward to greet Cochrane... raises his hand as if to wave. Cochrane raises his hand automatically, as if to wave in return... But then the Vulcan splits his fingers in the classic Vulcan greeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cochrane tries to emulate the Vulcan hand-sign...but can't quite do the awkward finger-split.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Vulcan cocks an eyebrow at him. The very first Alien-Human relationship is underway...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Live Long and Prosper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um... thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: are now surrounded by townspeople, who are watching the scene unfold...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our heroes share a glance with each other and smile, Riker taps his combadge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crew DEMATERIALIZES...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Riker to Enterprise. Five to beam up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: have now moved away from the crowd... no one paying attention to them. The bright lights from the Vulcan ship cast them in a dramatic silhouette. Picard turns to Ruby. It's the moment he's been dreading. This is goodbye. She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard struggles... he doesn't want to do this, but he's torn between his heart and his duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long, difficult moment... then he lets her go... turns and starts walking off into the night. She stands where she is, watching him go with tears in her eyes... Picard hits his combadge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops where he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard turns, looks back at Ruby. Their eyes meet... and he makes the decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts walking towards her. She sees him coming... starts running to him. She throws herself into his arms and he holds her close. They kiss. A magical moment, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They DEMATERIALIZE holding each other tight...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're leaving, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where? And don't tell me San Francisco...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It's a lot further than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the future, isn't it? Just like you told Scrimm. (beat) I knew you weren't from around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with humor) No... I'm from France.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care if you're from France or Venus... just take me with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This may be hard for you to understand... but I'm duty-bound not to interfere with you, or anyone else here... any more than is absolutely necessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've been interfering with my life ever since I met you. (with meaning) Don't stop now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ruby... I'm sorry. (remembering his words to Beverly) But our fates lie along different paths.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Picard to Enterprise. One to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Riker here. Captain, we didn't get your whole transmission.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To hell with fate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say again, Captain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enterprise. Two to beam up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE                                264 moving out of Earth orbit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                265 Riker, Worf, Troi, N.D.s. Picard ENTERS with Ruby. Everyone reacts to seeing her there. Ruby stays in the Turbolift, staring around the Bridge in amazement. Picard takes her hand and leads her out onto the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker glances at Ruby uneasily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances at Ruby again, awkward. But Picard finishes his thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard sits in his chair. Riker hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How's Mister Data?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Return to our own time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then make it so. Have you determined how to recreate the temporal vortex?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir. But Captain... are we... all going back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unless you'd like to stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bridge to Engineering. Mister La Forge... initiate the temporal vortex.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE                                266 moving through space... and then the TEMPORAL VORTEX forms directly ahead of it, as seen before. The ship
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the vortex...
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                268 As before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command. Admiral Hayes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Onscreen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Admiral Hayes appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The transmission ends. Ruby turns to Picard with amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard gives her a gentle smile. OFF the moment...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Admiral... what's the status of the Borg fleet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over. (beat) Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're fine, sir. It will take some... time to explain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I look forward to reading your report.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That makes two of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE                                270 The great ship entering a Starfleet SPACE DOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORG HIVE/ENVIROMENTAL CONTROL ROOM                   271 Geordi is directing a work crew of a dozen engineers, as they clean up the room and repair the damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The N.D.s move off, making notes on their PADDS. Geordi turns and sees Data standing in the doorway. He's now been fully restored to his original android self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi moves to him, puts a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi's smile fades a little as Data walks into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi points over to a corner, where some N.D.s are about to close a storage container. Data walks over. Geordi goes with him. The N.D.s move aside, and Data looks down into the storage container. The broken, mangles pieces of machinery are all that's left of the Borg Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data stares down at the remains with a haunted look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quiet beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi smiles a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data looks up at him -- his expression unreadable. Geordi's smile fades. Data reaches out, closes the lid on the storage container, turns and walks out of the room. Geordi watches him go, left to wonder what Data is really feeling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to a couple of N.D.s) No, no -- we'll have to rip out this entire bulkhead. We'll need new bracing members for the deck above and below.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look good as new.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could say that I'm back to my old self.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her remains... are they still here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sending them to the Daystrom Institute for analysis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never realized how powerful an emotion temptation could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Temptation? You said in your report it was all a ruse... you were manipulating her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was... a unique lifeform. In her own way... nearly perfect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joking) It almost sounds like you miss her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MONTANA - HILLTOP - DAY                               272 Picard and Ruby walk up the familiar hilltop, and when they reach the crest, we reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large memorial cordoned off by a chain. A PLAQUE on the monument reads "On this spot, Man and Vulcan met for the first time... and changed the course of history. March 3rd, 2063."
direction.name: direction
